attributes.comment:
The proposal to raise the fees for USCIS services is appalling. To try and validate
the hike of the I485 to $905 is unbelievable, 'oh well we worked out that people
who apply for an I485 will also apply for a travel document or two whilst they're
waiting along with other sundry documents we can charge them as they must
have the money'. All the applicants have is patience and lots of it because the
service from USCIS is terribly slow. We only need additional documents as the
I485 takes so long to process.
I have already paid for an I129f application, travel to London twice, $400 for a
medical, a K1 fiance visa, an 1485 and an I765 with the promise of more form
filling in once I've been here two years. I'm willing to work, willing to pay taxes but
because USCIS are so slow, my wife is supporting me.
I'm (nor are other applicants) a burden on the US as we have to provide an affadivit
of support from our wives/husbands and sign away any right to be a burden on the
state for upto ten years, despite being lawfully here and paying taxes.
To anyone that thinks this is good for the US because all the 'illegals' in their
neighborhoods are bringing their areas down get this into your dumb
heads, 'illegals' are just that, illegal, they do NOT make themselves known to the
USCIS for obvious reasons.
Raise the prices and drive away all the good people. Yeah, that's a real cool
plan ... not.
ROGER (US resident, UK citizen)
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Roger
